00026 // Fortran-compatible matrix: column oriented, 1-based (i,j) indexing
00027 
00028 #ifndef FMAT_H
00029 #define FMAT_H
00030 
00031 #include "tnt/subscript.h"
00032 #include "tnt/vec.h"
00033 #include <cstdlib>
00034 #include <cassert>
00035 #include <iostream>

00040 
00041 // simple 1-based, column oriented Matrix class
00042 
00043 namespace TNT
00044 {
00045 
00046 template <class T>
00047 class Fortran_Matrix 
00048 {
00049 
00050 
00051   public:
00052 
00053     typedef         T   value_type;
00054     typedef         T   element_type;
00055     typedef         T*  pointer;
00056     typedef         T*  iterator;
00057     typedef         T&  reference;
00058     typedef const   T*  const_iterator;
00059     typedef const   T&  const_reference;
00060 
00061     Subscript lbound() const { return 1;}
00062  
00063   protected:
00064     T* v_;                  // these are adjusted to simulate 1-offset
00065     Subscript m_;
00066     Subscript n_;
00067     T** col_;           // these are adjusted to simulate 1-offset
00068 
00069     // internal helper function to create the array
00070     // of row pointers
00071 
00072     void initialize(Subscript M, Subscript N)
00073     {
00074         // adjust col_[] pointers so that they are 1-offset:
00075         //   col_[j][i] is really col_[j-1][i-1];
00076         //
00077         // v_[] is the internal contiguous array, it is still 0-offset
00078         //
00079         v_ = new T[M*N];
00080         col_ = new T*[N];
00081 
00082         assert(v_  != NULL);
00083         assert(col_ != NULL);
00084 
00085 
00086         m_ = M;
00087         n_ = N;
00088         T* p = v_ - 1;              
00089         for (Subscript i=0; i<N; i++)
00090         {
00091             col_[i] = p;
00092             p += M ;
00093             
00094         }
00095         col_ --; 
00096     }
00097    
00098     void copy(const T*  v)
00099     {
00100         Subscript N = m_ * n_;
00101         Subscript i;
00102 
00103 #ifdef TNT_UNROLL_LOOPS
00104         Subscript Nmod4 = N & 3;
00105         Subscript N4 = N - Nmod4;
00106 
00107         for (i=0; i<N4; i+=4)
00108         {
00109             v_[i] = v[i];
00110             v_[i+1] = v[i+1];
00111             v_[i+2] = v[i+2];
00112             v_[i+3] = v[i+3];
00113         }
00114 
00115         for (i=N4; i< N; i++)
00116             v_[i] = v[i];
00117 #else
00118 
00119         for (i=0; i< N; i++)
00120             v_[i] = v[i];
00121 #endif      
00122     }
00123 
00124     void set(const T& val)
00125     {
00126         Subscript N = m_ * n_;
00127         Subscript i;
00128 
00129 #ifdef TNT_UNROLL_LOOPS
00130         Subscript Nmod4 = N & 3;
00131         Subscript N4 = N - Nmod4;
00132 
00133         for (i=0; i<N4; i+=4)
00134         {
00135             v_[i] = val;
00136             v_[i+1] = val;
00137             v_[i+2] = val;
00138             v_[i+3] = val; 
00139         }
00140 
00141         for (i=N4; i< N; i++)
00142             v_[i] = val;
00143 #else
00144 
00145         for (i=0; i< N; i++)
00146             v_[i] = val;
00147         
00148 #endif      
00149     }
00150     
00151 
00152 
00153     void destroy()
00154     {     
00155         /* do nothing, if no memory has been previously allocated */
00156         if (v_ == NULL) return ;
00157 
00158         /* if we are here, then matrix was previously allocated */
00159         delete [] (v_);     
00160         col_ ++;                // changed back to 0-offset
00161         delete [] (col_);
00162     }
00163 
00164 
00165   public:
00166 
00167     T* begin() { return v_; }
00168     const T* begin() const { return v_;}
00169 
00170     T* end() { return v_ + m_*n_; }
00171     const T* end() const { return v_ + m_*n_; }
00172 
00173 
00174     // constructors
00175 
00176     Fortran_Matrix() : v_(0), m_(0), n_(0), col_(0)  {};
00177     Fortran_Matrix(const Fortran_Matrix<T> &A)
00178     {
00179         initialize(A.m_, A.n_);
00180         copy(A.v_);
00181     }
00182 
00183     Fortran_Matrix(Subscript M, Subscript N, const T& value = T())
00184     {
00185         initialize(M,N);
00186         set(value);
00187     }
00188 
00189     Fortran_Matrix(Subscript M, Subscript N, const T* v)
00190     {
00191         initialize(M,N);
00192         copy(v);
00193     }
00194 
00195 
00196     Fortran_Matrix(Subscript M, Subscript N, char *s)
00197     {
00198         initialize(M,N);
00199         std::istrstream ins(s);
00200 
00201         Subscript i, j;
00202 
00203         for (i=1; i<=M; i++)
00204             for (j=1; j<=N; j++)
00205                 ins >> (*this)(i,j);
00206     }
00207 
00208     // destructor
00209     ~Fortran_Matrix()
00210     {
00211         destroy();
00212     }
00213 
00214 
00215     // assignments
00216     //
00217     Fortran_Matrix<T>& operator=(const Fortran_Matrix<T> &A)
00218     {
00219         if (v_ == A.v_)
00220             return *this;
00221 
00222         if (m_ == A.m_  && n_ == A.n_)      // no need to re-alloc
00223             copy(A.v_);
00224 
00225         else
00226         {
00227             destroy();
00228             initialize(A.m_, A.n_);
00229             copy(A.v_);
00230         }
00231 
00232         return *this;
00233     }
00234         
00235     Fortran_Matrix<T>& operator=(const T& scalar)
00236     { 
00237         set(scalar); 
00238         return *this;
00239     }
00240 
00241 
00242     Subscript dim(Subscript d) const 
00243     {
00244 #ifdef TNT_BOUNDS_CHECK
00245        assert( d >= 1);
00246         assert( d <= 2);
00247 #endif
00248         return (d==1) ? m_ : ((d==2) ? n_ : 0); 
00249     }
00250 
00251     Subscript num_rows() const { return m_; }
00252     Subscript num_cols() const { return n_; }
00253 
00254     Fortran_Matrix<T>& newsize(Subscript M, Subscript N)
00255     {
00256         if (num_rows() == M && num_cols() == N)
00257             return *this;
00258 
00259         destroy();
00260         initialize(M,N);
00261 
00262         return *this;
00263     }
00264 
00265 
00266 
00267     // 1-based element access
00268     //
00269     inline reference operator()(Subscript i, Subscript j)
00270     { 
00271 #ifdef TNT_BOUNDS_CHECK
00272         assert(1<=i);
00273         assert(i <= m_) ;
00274         assert(1<=j);
00275         assert(j <= n_);
00276 #endif
00277         return col_[j][i]; 
00278     }
00279 
00280     inline const_reference operator() (Subscript i, Subscript j) const
00281     {
00282 #ifdef TNT_BOUNDS_CHECK
00283         assert(1<=i);
00284         assert(i <= m_) ;
00285         assert(1<=j);
00286         assert(j <= n_);
00287 #endif
00288         return col_[j][i]; 
00289     }
00290 
00291 
00292 #ifdef TNT_USE_REGIONS
00293 
00294     typedef Region2D<Fortran_Matrix<T> > Region;
00295     typedef const_Region2D< Fortran_Matrix<T> > const_Region;
00296 
00297     Region operator()(const Index1D &I, const Index1D &J)
00298     {
00299         return Region(*this, I,J);
00300     }
00301 
00302     const_Region operator()(const Index1D &I, const Index1D &J) const
00303     {
00304         return const_Region(*this, I,J);
00305     }
00306 
00307 #endif
00308 
00309 
00310 };

00313 /* ***************************  I/O  ********************************/
00314 
00315 template <class T>
00316 std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream &s, const Fortran_Matrix<T> &A)
00317 {
00318     Subscript M=A.num_rows();
00319     Subscript N=A.num_cols();
00320 
00321     s << M << " " << N << "\n";
00322 
00323     for (Subscript i=1; i<=M; i++)
00324     {
00325         for (Subscript j=1; j<=N; j++)
00326         {
00327             s << A(i,j) << " ";
00328         }
00329         s << "\n";
00330     }
00331 
00332 
00333     return s;
00334 }
00335 
00336 template <class T>
00337 std::istream& operator>>(std::istream &s, Fortran_Matrix<T> &A)
00338 {
00339 
00340     Subscript M, N;
00341 
00342     s >> M >> N;
00343 
00344     if ( !(M == A.num_rows() && N == A.num_cols()))
00345     {
00346         A.newsize(M,N);
00347     }
00348 
00349 
00350     for (Subscript i=1; i<=M; i++)
00351         for (Subscript j=1; j<=N; j++)
00352         {
00353             s >>  A(i,j);
00354         }
00355 
00356 
00357     return s;
00358 }

00360 // *******************[ basic matrix algorithms ]***************************
00361 
00362 
00363 template <class T>
00364 Fortran_Matrix<T> operator+(const Fortran_Matrix<T> &A, 
00365     const Fortran_Matrix<T> &B)
00366 {
00367     Subscript M = A.num_rows();
00368     Subscript N = A.num_cols();
00369 
00370     assert(M==B.num_rows());
00371     assert(N==B.num_cols());
00372 
00373     Fortran_Matrix<T> tmp(M,N);
00374     Subscript i,j;
00375 
00376     for (i=1; i<=M; i++)
00377         for (j=1; j<=N; j++)
00378             tmp(i,j) = A(i,j) + B(i,j);
00379 
00380     return tmp;
00381 }
00382 
00383 template <class T>
00384 Fortran_Matrix<T> operator-(const Fortran_Matrix<T> &A, 
00385     const Fortran_Matrix<T> &B)
00386 {
00387     Subscript M = A.num_rows();
00388     Subscript N = A.num_cols();
00389 
00390     assert(M==B.num_rows());
00391     assert(N==B.num_cols());
00392 
00393     Fortran_Matrix<T> tmp(M,N);
00394     Subscript i,j;
00395 
00396     for (i=1; i<=M; i++)
00397         for (j=1; j<=N; j++)
00398             tmp(i,j) = A(i,j) - B(i,j);
00399 
00400     return tmp;
00401 }
00402 
00403 // element-wise multiplication  (use matmult() below for matrix
00404 // multiplication in the linear algebra sense.)
00405 //
00406 //
00407 template <class T>
00408 Fortran_Matrix<T> mult_element(const Fortran_Matrix<T> &A, 
00409     const Fortran_Matrix<T> &B)
00410 {
00411     Subscript M = A.num_rows();
00412     Subscript N = A.num_cols();
00413 
00414     assert(M==B.num_rows());
00415     assert(N==B.num_cols());
00416 
00417     Fortran_Matrix<T> tmp(M,N);
00418     Subscript i,j;
00419 
00420     for (i=1; i<=M; i++)
00421         for (j=1; j<=N; j++)
00422             tmp(i,j) = A(i,j) * B(i,j);
00423 
00424     return tmp;
00425 }
00426 
00427 
00428 template <class T>
00429 Fortran_Matrix<T> transpose(const Fortran_Matrix<T> &A)
00430 {
00431     Subscript M = A.num_rows();
00432     Subscript N = A.num_cols();
00433 
00434     Fortran_Matrix<T> S(N,M);
00435     Subscript i, j;
00436 
00437     for (i=1; i<=M; i++)
00438         for (j=1; j<=N; j++)
00439             S(j,i) = A(i,j);
00440 
00441     return S;
00442 }

00445     
00446 template <class T>
00447 inline Fortran_Matrix<T> matmult(const Fortran_Matrix<T>  &A, 
00448     const Fortran_Matrix<T> &B)
00449 {
00450 
00451 #ifdef TNT_BOUNDS_CHECK
00452     assert(A.num_cols() == B.num_rows());
00453 #endif
00454 
00455     Subscript M = A.num_rows();
00456     Subscript N = A.num_cols();
00457     Subscript K = B.num_cols();
00458 
00459     Fortran_Matrix<T> tmp(M,K);
00460     T sum;
00461 
00462     for (Subscript i=1; i<=M; i++)
00463     for (Subscript k=1; k<=K; k++)
00464     {
00465         sum = 0;
00466         for (Subscript j=1; j<=N; j++)
00467             sum = sum +  A(i,j) * B(j,k);
00468 
00469         tmp(i,k) = sum; 
00470     }
00471 
00472     return tmp;
00473 }
00474 
00475 template <class T>
00476 inline Fortran_Matrix<T> operator*(const Fortran_Matrix<T> &A, 
00477     const Fortran_Matrix<T> &B)
00478 {
00479     return matmult(A,B);
00480 }
00481 
00482 template <class T>
00483 inline int matmult(Fortran_Matrix<T>& C, const Fortran_Matrix<T>  &A, 
00484     const Fortran_Matrix<T> &B)
00485 {
00486 
00487     assert(A.num_cols() == B.num_rows());
00488 
00489     Subscript M = A.num_rows();
00490     Subscript N = A.num_cols();
00491     Subscript K = B.num_cols();
00492 
00493     C.newsize(M,K);         // adjust shape of C, if necessary
00494 
00495 
00496     T sum; 
00497 
00498     const T* row_i;
00499     const T* col_k;
00500 
00501     for (Subscript i=1; i<=M; i++)
00502     {
00503         for (Subscript k=1; k<=K; k++)
00504         {
00505             row_i = &A(i,1);
00506             col_k = &B(1,k);
00507             sum = 0;
00508             for (Subscript j=1; j<=N; j++)
00509             {
00510                 sum +=  *row_i * *col_k;
00511                 row_i += M;
00512                 col_k ++;
00513             }
00514         
00515             C(i,k) = sum; 
00516         }
00517 
00518     }
00519 
00520     return 0;
00521 }
00522 
00523 
00524 template <class T>
00525 Vector<T> matmult(const Fortran_Matrix<T>  &A, const Vector<T> &x)
00526 {
00527 
00528 #ifdef TNT_BOUNDS_CHECK
00529     assert(A.num_cols() == x.dim());
00530 #endif
00531 
00532     Subscript M = A.num_rows();
00533     Subscript N = A.num_cols();
00534 
00535     Vector<T> tmp(M);
00536     T sum;
00537 
00538     for (Subscript i=1; i<=M; i++)
00539     {
00540         sum = 0;
00541         for (Subscript j=1; j<=N; j++)
00542             sum = sum +  A(i,j) * x(j);
00543 
00544         tmp(i) = sum; 
00545     }
00546 
00547     return tmp;
00548 }
00549 
00550 template <class T>
00551 inline Vector<T> operator*(const Fortran_Matrix<T>  &A, const Vector<T> &x)
00552 {
00553     return matmult(A,x);
00554 }
00555 
00556 template <class T>
00557 inline Fortran_Matrix<T> operator*(const Fortran_Matrix<T>  &A, const T &x)
00558 {
00559     Subscript M = A.num_rows();
00560     Subscript N = A.num_cols();
00561 
00562     Subscript MN = M*N; 
00563 
00564     Fortran_Matrix<T> res(M,N);
00565     const T* a = A.begin();
00566     T* t = res.begin();
00567     T* tend = res.end();
00568 
00569     for (t=res.begin(); t < tend; t++, a++)
00570         *t = *a * x;
00571 
00572     return res;
00573 } 
00574 
00575 }  // namespace TNT
